intro: Atractantha amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Atractantha amazonica is adapted to the humid, nutrient-rich soils of the Amazon basin and plays a role in the region's biodiversity.
